name: Norden's Map of Lancashire (c.1607-10)
description: John Norden's county survey of Lancashire. Norden attempted a complete county-by-county survey of England but only completed a few counties. Lancashire may survive in manuscript.
notes:
John Norden (c.1547-1625), surveyor and cartographer.
Attempted the 'Speculum Britanniae' — a county-by-county survey.
Completed Middlesex (1593) and Hertfordshire (1598) fully.
Lancashire survey status uncertain — may exist in manuscript only.
Norden introduced roads on county maps before Ogilby.
Historical significance as early attempted systematic survey.
